Detailed Description

Parser state machine implementation.

(t)->token_len = ((t)->token_len ? (t)->token_len - 1 : 0) ;        \
    (t)->buf[(t)->token_len] = '\0';

Function Documentation

static cparser_state_t cparser_err_char ( cparser_t *  parser,
const char  ch,
int *  ch_processed 
) [static]

Process a character in ERROR state.

There is one possibility: 1) for any characters -> insert character/ERROR

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
ch Character to be input which must [SPC].
Return values:
ch_processed 1 if the character is used; 0 if the character is rejected by the parser FSM.
Returns:
New parser state.

int cparser_match ( const cparser_t *  parser,
const char *  token,
const int  token_len,
cparser_node_t *  parent,
cparser_node_t **  match,
int *  is_complete 
)

Walk through all children of a node.

Return a match node if one is found.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
token Pointer to the beginning of the token.
token_len Length of the token.
parent Pointer to the parent node.
Return values:
match Pointer to a node that matches the token. If there are multiple matches, the highest priority match is returned.
is_complete 1 if the token completely matches
Returns:
Number of matches.

static cparser_state_t cparser_tok_char ( cparser_t *  parser,
const char  ch,
int *  ch_processed 
) [static]

Process a character in TOKEN state.

There are three possibilities: 1) there are too many characters in the token already -> do nothing/

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
ch Character to be input which must [SPC].
Return values:
ch_processed 1 if the character is used; 0 if the character is rejected by the parser FSM.
Returns:
New parser state.

Definition at line 318 of file cparser_fsm.c.

static cparser_state_t cparser_tok_erase ( cparser_t *  parser,
const char  ch,
int *  ch_processed 
) [static]

Process a BS in TOKEN state.

There are two possibilities: 1) This is not the last character of the token -> delete character/TOKEN, 2) This is the last character of the token -> delete character/WHITESPACE.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
ch Character to be input which must [SPC].
Return values:
ch_processed 1 if the character is used; 0 if the character is rejected by the parser FSM.
Returns:
New parser state.

Definition at line 241 of file cparser_fsm.c.

static cparser_state_t cparser_tok_space ( cparser_t *  parser,
const char  ch,
int *  ch_processed 
) [static]

Process a SPC in TOKEN state.

There are two possibilities: 1) The token was unique and complete -> insert character, update cur_node/WHITESPACE, 2) Otherwise -> insert character/ERROR.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
ch Character to be input which must [SPC].
Return values:
ch_processed 1 if the character is used; 0 if the character is rejected by the parser FSM.
Returns:
New parser state.

parser Pointer to the parser structure.
Returns:
None.

Definition at line 103 of file cparser_fsm.c.

static cparser_state_t cparser_ws_char ( cparser_t *  parser,
const char  ch,
int *  ch_processed 
) [static]

Process a character in WHITESPACE state.

There are two possibilities: 1) the new character is a valid token -> insert char/TOKEN, 2) the new character is an invalid token -> insert char/ERROR.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
ch Character to be input which must [SPC].
Return values:
ch_processed 1 if the character is used; 0 if the character is rejected by the parser FSM.
Returns:
New parser state.

Definition at line 205 of file cparser_fsm.c.

static cparser_state_t cparser_ws_erase ( cparser_t *  parser,
const char  ch,
int *  ch_processed 
) [static]

Process a BS in WHITESPACE state.

There are two possibilities: 1) after erasing a character, we are in the end of a token -> erase character/TOKEN, 2) after erasing a character, the previous character is still a SPC -> erase character/WHITESPACE.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
ch Character to be input which must [BS].
Return values:
ch_processed 1 if the character is used; 0 if the character is rejected by the parser FSM.
Returns:
New parser state.

Definition at line 138 of file cparser_fsm.c.

static cparser_state_t cparser_ws_space ( cparser_t *  parser,
const char  ch,
int *  ch_processed 
) [static]

Process a SPC in WHITESPACE state.

There are one possibility: 1) there is space left -> insert SPC/WHITESPACE.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
ch Character to be input which must [SPC].
Return values:
ch_processed 1 if the character is used; 0 if the character is rejected by the parser FSM.
Returns:
New parser state.

cparser_state_func cparser_state_func_tbl[CPARSER_MAX_STATES][3]

Initial value:

 {
    { cparser_ws_erase,  cparser_ws_space,  cparser_ws_char }, 
    { cparser_tok_erase, cparser_tok_space, cparser_tok_char }, 
    { cparser_err_erase, cparser_err_space, cparser_err_char } }
